tn.ref: the twenty-fourth day of the same month
tn.text: fourth day of the same month** - "the twenty-fourth day of the seventh month" This is near the middle of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: the people of Israel were assembled
tn.text: "the people of Israel came together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: they were wearing sackcloth, and they put dust on their heads
tn.text: This was in order to show how sorry they were for the wrong things they and their ancestors had done. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"The Israelites"

tn.ref: separated themselves from all the foreigners
tn.text: "no longer had anything to do with those who were not Israelites"

tn.ref: They stood and confessed their own sins and the evil actions of their ancestors
tn.text: "They admitted the wrong things that they had done and also the wrong things their forefathers had done"
All the Israelites stood up
"they were admitting the wrong things they had done"
"and worshiping" or "and praising"

tn.ref: The Levites, Jeshua, Bani ... stood on the stairs
tn.text: Some versions translate, "Jeshua, Bani ... stood on the stairs built for the Levites"

tn.ref: Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani
tn.text: men's names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Then the Levites ... said, "Stand up ... ever."
tn.text: Here the Levites are speaking to the people of Israel.
"bless Yahweh"
men's names. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:neh:09:03|9:3-4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
men's names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: May they bless your glorious name
tn.text: the Levites are speaking to Yahweh. "May the people of Judah bless your glorious name, Yahweh"

tn.ref: the highest heavens, with all their host ... the host of heaven worship you
tn.text: A host is an army. The "host of heaven" speaks in a metaphor of the many stars as if they were an army. The stars in turn are a metaphor for the many angels. The stars worshiping Yahweh is a metaphor for the angels worshiping Yahweh. (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The Levites continue their prayer before all the people.
"Ur, where the Chaldean people group lived"

tn.ref: You found his heart was faithful before you
tn.text: The heart, the inner being of the person, represents the person. AT: "You saw that he was completely faithful to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Canaanites ... Hittites ... Amorites ... Perizzites ... Jebusites ... Girgashites
tn.text: people group names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
Yahweh saw
The implied information is that God was moved to action because of the Israelites' cries for help. (See: [[[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The plagues tested Pharaoh's heart, and they became a witness against his hardness of heart. AT: "signs and wonders that testified against Pharaoh" or "signs and wonders that condemned Pharaoh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: all the people of his land
tn.text: "all the Egyptians"
"were arrogant toward the Israelites" or "mistreated God's chosen people"

tn.ref: you made a name for yourself
tn.text: This is another way of saying "you showed the world your character" or "you demonstrated your power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"which people still remember"
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
God divided

tn.ref: you ... threw those who pursued them into the depths, as a stone into deep waters
tn.text: In this simile, the writer describes God throwing the Egyptians into the sea as easily as a person would throw a stone into water, and the stone would disappear under the water completely. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
Yahweh led the Israelites.

When God talks with his people, he is often described as "coming down" or "coming down from heaven." This is a descriptive way of saying that God appeared to that person. AT: "you appeared" or "you came down from heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: righteous decrees and true laws, good statutes and commandments
tn.text: Both of these double phrases describe the same thing, the law of Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
Each of these three words refers to the law of Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
the Israelites at the time of Moses and the people of Israel after the time of Moses
The literal statement is "they hardened their necks." If your language has a different idiom for being stubborn, you may want to use it here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the wonders that you had done among them
tn.text: "the miracles that you had done among them"

tn.ref: they appointed a leader to return to their slavery
tn.text: "they appointed a leader to take them back to the land where they had been slaves." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The desire to forgive is spoken of as if it were a liquid that could fill a container. AT: "who is ready to forgive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Love is spoken of as if it were a food crop that Yahweh could share with people. AT: "loves his people very much" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
Yahweh did not abandon the Israelites.

tn.ref: cast a calf out of molten metal
tn.text: melted metal and molded it in the shape of a calf

tn.ref: The pillar of cloud ... the pillar of fire
tn.text: Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:neh:09:12|09:12]].
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Your good Spirit ... your manna ... water
tn.text: The writer changes the usual word order to emphasize the good things Yahweh gave his people. Your language may have another way of emphasizing these items.
"teach"

tn.ref: and your manna you did not withhold from their mouths
tn.text: This litotes can be expressed positively. AT: "and you generously gave them manna" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
The mouth is a synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "from them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
Yahweh gave the Israelites kingdoms.
"enabled them to conquer kingdoms and peoples"

tn.ref: assigning to them every corner of the landr
tn.text: "enabling them to possess every part of the land"
These are the names of kings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
Yahweh made the descendants of the Israelites at the time of Moses

The Canaanites are spoken of as if they were small objects that a person could place in the hand of another person. To give something into a person's hand is to give that person complete control over that thing. AT: "enabled the Israelites to have complete control over them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
The Israelites at the time of Moses captured
"a fertile land"
holes in the ground where people store water
This might be a metaphor for "stopped thinking about Yahweh" or "became complacent." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.

tn.ref: They threw your law behind their backs
tn.text: The law is spoken of as if it were a worthless item that a person could throw away. AT: "They considered your law worthless and paid no attention to it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The Israelites threw Yahweh's law.

tn.ref: you gave them into the hand of their enemies
tn.text: Here the word "hand" (a part) signifies the power of the "enemies" (as whole persons) to do harm. AT: "you allowed your people's enemies to harm your people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you sent them rescuers who rescued them out of the hand of their enemies
tn.text: Here the word "hand" (a part) signifies the power of the "enemies" (as whole persons) to do harm. AT: "you sent people to stop their enemies from harming them"
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.

tn.ref: they had rest, they did evil again before you
tn.text: Here "they" refers to the Israelites and "you" to Yahweh.

tn.ref: you abandoned them to the hand of their enemies
tn.text: Here the word "hand" (a part) signifies the "enemies" (as a whole) to do harm. AT: "you allowed their enemies to harm them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: did not listen to your commands
tn.text: If your language has a word for "listen" that also means "obey," use it here.

tn.ref: your decrees which give life to anyone who obeys them
tn.text: Yahweh himself is spoken of as if he were the decrees themselves. AT: "you even though you give life to everyone who obeys your decrees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.

tn.ref: you gave them into the hand of the neighboring peoples
tn.text: Here the word "hand" (a part) signifies the power of the "neighboring peoples" (as whole persons) to do harm. AT: "you allowed the neighboring peoples to harm your people" Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:neh:09:26|9:27]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh gave

tn.ref: you did not make a complete end of them
tn.text: "you did not destroy them"
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.

tn.ref: do not let all this hardship seem little to you that has come on us ... until today
tn.text: It is possible to divide this into two sentences. "Do not let all this hardship seem little to you. The hardship has come upon us ... until today"

tn.ref: hardship ... has come on us ... everything that has come on us
tn.text: The phrase "come on us" speaks of bad things that happen as if they are people who cause harm. AT: "harm ... we have suffered ... everything we have suffered" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.

tn.ref: while they enjoyed your great goodness to them
tn.text: "while they enjoyed the good things you gave them"
"they were not obedient to your law or teaching"
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
"all the good things in it" or "all the good things we can get from it"

tn.ref: The rich yield from our land goes to the kings
tn.text: "We pay tribute to kings for working our own land"
The kings rule.
In these verses, the Levites continue to praise Yahweh in the presence of the people of Israel.
because the people had disobeyed and Yahweh had punished them

tn.ref: On the sealed document are the names
tn.text: The reader should understand that the men wrote their names on the document before it was sealed.
